# Departments of the Republic of the Congo

The Republic of the Congo is divided into 15 departments since the adoption of the corresponding laws in October 2024. These departments replaced former regions (régions, singular région) in 2002:
According to the laws published in October 2024 and the cartographic coordinates, the new regions are:
- Congo-Oubangui. Formed by the districts of: Bokoma, Liranga (formely in Likouala), Loukoléla District and Mossaka.
- Nkéni-Alima. Formed by the districts of: Makotimpoko District, Ongogni District, Gamboma, Abala and Allembé District.
- Djoué-Léfini. Formed by the districts of: Ngabé, Mayama, Vindza, Kimba and Ignié.
These regions are subdivided into more than 100 districts and 16 communes; which are further subdivided into urban communities (communautés urbaines) and rural communities (communautés rurales); which are further subdivided into quarters or neighborhoods (quartiers) and villages.
